DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the grade or highest level of education attained by a person.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A demographic parameter indicating the number of years of schooling or the highest level of achievement at school by a human being.

Property.preferredDefinition: A demographic parameter indicating the number of years of schooling or the highest level of achievement at school.

Concepts.definition: An indication of the years of schooling completed in graded public, private, or parochial schools, and in colleges, universities, or professional schools.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/1/07 removed CSI reference to proposed.  9/14/07-released.  6/11/07- Completed to support caBIG Education Level standard.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An indication of the years of schooling completed in graded public, private, or parochial schools, and in colleges, universities, or professional schools._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Beginnning at age 5-7 and continuing for about 4-6 years. The U.S. equivalent starts with 1st grade and ends with 6th grade.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Beginnning at age 5-7 and continuing for about 4-6 years. The U.S. equivalent starts with 1st grade and ends with 6th grade.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Beginnning at age 5-7 and continuing for about 4-6 years. The U.S. equivalent starts with 1st grade and ends with 6th grade.

PermissibleValues.value: No primary education / under school age
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No schooling. The US equivalent is less than 1st grade education.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No schooling. The US equivalent is less than 1st grade education.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No schooling. The US equivalent is less than 1st grade education.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Programs that lead to the award of an advanced post-graduate degree, such as a Ph.D.  The U.S. equivalent is programs devoted to advanced study and original research.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Programs that lead to the award of an advanced post-graduate degree, such as a Ph.D.  The U.S. equivalent is programs devoted to advanced study and original research.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Programs that lead to the award of an advanced post-graduate degree, such as a Ph.D.  The U.S. equivalent is programs devoted to advanced study and original research.

PermissibleValues.value: Less than primary or elementary education
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Some formal schooling, but less than a complete primary or elementary education. The U.S. equivalent is more than 1st grade education, but less than 6th grade education.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Some formal schooling, but less than a complete primary or elementary education. The U.S. equivalent is more than 1st grade education, but less than 6th grade education.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Some formal schooling, but less than a complete primary or elementary education. The U.S. equivalent is more than 1st grade education, but less than 6th grade education.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Beginning at about age 11-12 and continuing for about 2-3 years. The U.S. equivalent starts with 7th grade and typically ends with 9th grade.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Beginning at about age 11-12 and continuing for about 2-3 years. The U.S. equivalent starts with 7th grade and typically ends with 9th grade.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Beginning at about age 11-12 and continuing for about 2-3 years. The U.S. equivalent starts with 7th grade and typically ends with 9th grade.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Programs lasting 6 months to 2 years. The U.S. equivalent is vocational programs of study.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Programs lasting 6 months to 2 years. The U.S. equivalent is vocational programs of study.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Programs lasting 6 months to 2 years. The U.S. equivalent is vocational programs of study.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Beginning at about age 15-16 and continuing for about 3 years. The U.S. equivalent starts with 10th grade and ends with 12th grade.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Beginning at about age 15-16 and continuing for about 3 years. The U.S. equivalent starts with 10th grade and ends with 12th grade.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Beginning at about age 15-16 and continuing for about 3 years. The U.S. equivalent starts with 10th grade and ends with 12th grade.

Type A: programs that provide education that is largely theoretical, lasting 3-4 years (U.S. equivalent: includes university programs that last 4 years and lead to the award of a bachelor's degree, and university programs that lead to a master's degree). Type B: programs that focus on practical, technical or occupational skills with a minimum duration of 2 years of full-time enrollment (U.S. equivalent: programs typically offered at community colleges that lead to an associate's degree)
